landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of To Kill a Mockingbird
landing-pages.description: In the small town of Maycomb, Alabama, Jean Louise "Scout" Finch lives with her father, Atticus, a lawyer, and her brother, Jem. When Atticus is appointed to defend Tom Robinson, a black man falsely accused of raping a white woman, Scout and Jem learn about racism and courage.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of 1984
landing-pages.description: In a dystopian future, Winston Smith works for the Thought Police, rewriting history to fit the ruling party's ideology. But when he starts to question the Party, he risks everything.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of The Great Gatsby
landing-pages.description: The story of Jay Gatsby, a wealthy man who throws lavish parties in the hopes of winning back the love of his life, Daisy Buchanan.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
landing-pages.book_title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
landing-pages.description: Harry Potter is an orphaned boy who discovers on his eleventh birthday that he is the orphaned son of two powerful wizards and possesses unique magical powers of his own. He is summoned from his life as an unwanted child by his parents' friend Albus Dumbledore, a powerful sorcerer and headmaster of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Harry learns about magic and makes friends with Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger. Together, they face many challenges, including an evil wizard named Lord Voldemort who intends to become immortal.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of The Lord of the Rings
landing-pages.description: The Lord of the Rings is an epic high fantasy trilogy written by English philologist and University of Oxford professor J. R. R. Tolkien. The story began as a sequel to Tolkien's 1937 fantasy novel The Hobbit, but eventually developed into a much larger work. Written in stages between 1937 and 1949, with much of it being written during World War II, it was originally published in three volumes in 1954 and 1955. It has since been reprinted numerous times and translated into at least 38 languages, becoming one of the best-selling novels ever written.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Animal Farm
landing-pages.description: Animal Farm is a satirical novella by George Orwell, first published in England on 17 August 1945. The book tells the story of a group of farm animals who rebel against their human farmer, hoping to create a better life for themselves. However, the rebellion eventually fails, and the farm is taken over by a pig named Napoleon, who becomes a ruthless dictator.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of The Catcher in the Rye
landing-pages.description: The Catcher in the Rye is a novel by J. D. Salinger that was first published in 1951. The novel is narrated by Holden Caulfield, a teenager who has just been expelled from prep school. Holden is a complex and troubled character who is struggling to find his place in the world. The novel explores themes of adolescence, alienation, and the loss of innocence.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of The Little Prince
landing-pages.description: The Little Prince is a novella by French aristocrat, writer, poet and pioneering aviator Antoine de Saint-Exupéry. The novella is the most famous work of Saint-Exupéry, and was voted the best book of the 20th century in France. The novella is a philosophical tale, and tells the story of a pilot who crashes in the Sahara Desert and meets a young prince from a tiny asteroid. The prince tells the pilot about his life on the asteroid, and the pilot learns about the importance of love, friendship, and imagination.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of Brave New World
landing-pages.description: In a dystopian future, humans are genetically engineered and conditioned to be happy consumers.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of Ulysses
landing-pages.description: A complex and experimental novel that follows the protagonist, Leopold Bloom, on a single day in Dublin.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of Fahrenheit 451
landing-pages.description: In a dystopian future, books are outlawed and burned by firemen.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of Dune
landing-pages.description: A science fiction novel set on the desert planet Arrakis, where humans must mine a valuable spice.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of One Hundred Years of Solitude
landing-pages.description: A magical realist novel that tells the story of the Buendía family over seven generations.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
landing-pages.description: The story of a boy named Huckleberry Finn who runs away from home and travels down the Mississippi River with an escaped slave.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of The Lord of the Flies
landing-pages.description: A novel about a group of boys who are stranded on an island and must learn to govern themselves.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of The Grapes of Wrath
landing-pages.description: A novel about a family of farmers who are forced to leave their home during the Great Depression.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of The Wind in the Willows
landing-pages.description: A children's novel about a group of animals who live in the English countryside.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of The Adventures of Amina al-Sirafi
landing-pages.description: Amina al-Sirafi is a retired captain who once sailed the high seas as a pirate. But now she lives a quiet life with her daughter, Marjana. When a wealthy woman asks Amina to help find her kidnapped granddaughter, Amina agrees. But the job is more dangerous than she expected, and soon Amina is caught up in a web of intrigue that threatens her family and her freedom.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of A Curse for True Love
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Anya must break the curse that binds her to a dangerous djinn in order to save her kingdom.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of All the Dangerous Things
landing-pages.description: In a world where magic is forbidden, a young woman named Anya must choose between her dreams and her duty to her family.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of A Day of Fallen Night
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Alice must face her own dark past when she returns to the city where she grew up.

landing-pages.image_alt: book cover of Emily Wilde's Encyclopaedia of Faeries
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Emily Wilde is tasked with writing an encyclopedia of faeries. But as she gets to know the faeries, she begins to question everything she thought she knew about them.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Final Offer
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Nora is offered a million dollars to marry a stranger.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Fourth Wing
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Dani has the power to see ghosts. When she meets a mysterious man named Seth, she learns that he is also a ghost whisperer.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Happy Place
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Alice must confront her past when she returns to her hometown.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Heir of Broken Fate
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Aella must stop a dark force from destroying her world.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Hell Bent
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Addie must travel to Hell to rescue her sister.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Hello Beautiful
landing-pages.description: Sixteen-year-old Nala Simone is a beautiful, popular girl who has everything she could ever want. But when her family's secrets are revealed, Nala's world is turned upside down. She must learn to embrace her true self and find her voice in a world that is trying to silence her.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of The Stolen Heir
landing-pages.description: In a world where magic is real, but only for a select few, a young woman named Anya must find a way to use her powers to save her kingdom from a dark force.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of How to Sell a Haunted House
landing-pages.book_title: How to Sell a Haunted House
landing-pages.description: When a young woman inherits a haunted house, she must find a way to sell it before it's too late.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Love Theoretically
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Olive is a mathematics genius who is tasked with writing a love story. But she doesn't believe in love, so she decides to base her story on data. However, as she gets to know her research assistant, she begins to question everything she thought she knew about love.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of In the Lives of Puppets
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Valeria travels to Mexico to investigate the disappearance of a group of migrant children. But as she gets closer to the truth, she begins to question her own identity.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of The Collected Regrets of Clover
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Clover is trying to forget her past, but when she returns to her hometown, she is forced to confront the regrets that she has been carrying with her.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Spare
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Spare is a member of a group of people who are born without souls. When she is offered a chance to have a soul, she must decide whether or not she is willing to give up her unique identity.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Tress of the Emerald Sea
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Akiko is tasked with finding a magical tress that can save her kingdom. But as she gets closer to the truth, she begins to question everything she thought she knew about herself.

landing-pages.image_alt: Image of the book cover of Yellowface
landing-pages.description: A young woman named Mei is cast in a play about a Chinese American family. But as she gets to know the other actors, she begins to question the stereotypes that are being perpetuated in the play.
